org.fluidity.testing

Interface Simulator.Composite<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the mock object.
    Enclosing class:
    Simulator

    public static interface Simulator.Composite<T>
    Composite mock object. A composite is used in multi-threaded tests to create thread specific mock objects of some dependency of the object under test.

    The composite is created in the main thread for each dependency of the object under test that will be invoked concurrently, and a composite mock object, returned by the dependency() method, is passed to the object under test instead of a mock object as would be in a serial test case.

    Each concurrent thread must create its own mock object for each dependency it sets up expectations on, using one of the normal(), lenient(), and ordered() methods of this interface.

    Usage

    Assuming SomComponent with a Dependency dependency, the following example shows the use of composites and thread local mock objects. 
     public class SomeComponentTest extends Simulator {

   private final Composite<Dependency> composite = composite(Dependency.class, dependencies().normal(Dependency.class));
   private final SomeComponent component = new SomeComponent(composite.dependency());

   …

   @Test
   public void testConcurrency() throws Exception {
     final Threads threads = newThreads("concurrency");

     threads.concurrent(new Task.Concurrent() {
       public Task run(final MockObjects factory) throws Exception {
         final Dependency dependency = composite.normal():

         …

         return new Task() {
           …
         }
       }
     });

     …

     threads.guarantee(…);
   }
 }

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T dependency()
      Returns the composite object to pass to the object under test.
      T lenient()
      Creates a new lenient mock object using the Simulator.MockObjects.lenient(Class) method passed to the concurrent task this method is invoked from, and adds it to this composite object to be used in the thread corresponding to that concurrent task.
      T normal()
      Creates a new normal mock object using the Simulator.MockObjects.normal(Class) method passed to the concurrent task this method is invoked from, and adds it to this composite object to be used in the thread corresponding to that concurrent task.
      T ordered()
      Creates a new ordered mock object using the Simulator.MockObjects.ordered(Class) method passed to the concurrent task this method is invoked from, and adds it to this composite object to be used in the thread corresponding to that concurrent task.
      void use(T mock)
      Tells this composite object to use the given mock object in the calling thread.

    • Method Detail

      • dependency

        T dependency()
        Returns the composite object to pass to the object under test. The returned object is not a mock object, it cannot be used to set up expectations. To set up expectations, use the original object passed to Simulator.composite(Class, Object) when creating this object in the main thread, and create new mock objects in other threads using one of the normal(), lenient(), and ordered() methods.
        Returns:
        the composite object to pass to the object under test.

      • normal

        T normal()
        Creates a new normal mock object using the Simulator.MockObjects.normal(Class) method passed to the concurrent task this method is invoked from, and adds it to this composite object to be used in the thread corresponding to that concurrent task.
        Returns:
        a new normal mock object.

      • lenient

        T lenient()
        Creates a new lenient mock object using the Simulator.MockObjects.lenient(Class) method passed to the concurrent task this method is invoked from, and adds it to this composite object to be used in the thread corresponding to that concurrent task.
        Returns:
        a new lenient mock object.

      • ordered

        T ordered()
        Creates a new ordered mock object using the Simulator.MockObjects.ordered(Class) method passed to the concurrent task this method is invoked from, and adds it to this composite object to be used in the thread corresponding to that concurrent task.
        Returns:
        a new ordered mock object.

      • use

        void use(T mock)
        Tells this composite object to use the given mock object in the calling thread. You only use this method if the calling thread was not created by a call to Simulator.Threads.concurrent(Simulator.Task.Concurrent).
        Parameters:
        mock - the mock object to use in the calling thread.
